headline: Election objectors are among the GOP’s highest fundraisers ahead of Jan. 6 anniversary
author: Melissa Holzberg
sentences: While Republican leadership members like McCarthy, Scalise and Rep. Elise Stefanik (R-N.Y.) all objected to the Electoral College count, they’ve been reluctant to defend the actions of rioters on Jan. 6, unlike some of the other top fundraising election objectors in their conference.

Republican objectors cited baseless claims of fraudulent vote counts, rigged voting machines and former President Donald Trump’s allegations of voter fraud as the reasons they voted to object to Biden’s win.
Now, a year after the riot, many of the House members who objected to the election results are some of the top fundraisers in the Republican House conference going into the 2022 midterm elections.
While the majority of House Republicans voted against certifying the Electoral College vote in 2020, a few top Republican fundraisers stood out for voting in favor of the certification.
